questions.question: 'The Greek hero Bellerophon was crippled when he fell off this winged steed'

'In "The Lord of the Rings", Gandalf rides this horse that only he could tame'
'Alexander the Great conquered much of the known world riding this stallion'

'Stolichanya, or stoli to its friends, is a brand of this'

'Mon Dieu!  This French liqueur was originally made at the Abbey of Fecamp by the monks for which it is named'

'This round, red firecracker has been banned by U.S. law since 1966'
'Referring to something dear, this phrase originated in Deuteronomy 32:10 & refers to the pupil'
'Tolkien once wrote, "I am in fact" one of these "in all but size"'
'While at Oxford, Tolkien formed a literary group called the Inklings with this man who wrote of Narnia'

'The title "The Lord of the Rings" refers to this dark lord'

'Herding these is a traditional basis of the Lapp economy'

'To refuse to buy a company's products as a means of coercion'

'A class of the old Russian nobility ranking below the princes'

'Its website has been called the first large-scale directory of the Internet'

'At first a bad guy, in later movies he protected Earth from alien monsters like Gigan & Megalon'

'This 2008 flick depicts an alien invasion of NYC seen through the video camera eyes of several young characters'

'Fans of his "Brazil" can buy it on DVD in a longer, expanded version'
'The voice of the parrot in Douglas Adams' "Starship Titanic"; he also novelized the game'

'This cake that's soaked in liquor may derive its name from the Polish for "old woman"'

final-jeopardy.question: '"Shouldn't the shining dots of the sky be as accessible as the black dots on the map of France?" the artist wrote of this work'
final-jeopardy.answer: The Starry Night (by Vincent Van Gogh)
